channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Neil Young says Spotify has a responsibility to mitigate the spread of misinformation on its platform https://t.co/CLTr6PgaoX
Lourdes Maldonado, a well-known local television personality in Tijuana, became the second Mexican journalist in a week to be gunned down in the border city https://t.co/2rqZ0Wiqrl

Elon Musk wants McDonald’s to start accepting dogecoin for payment. The Tesla CEO has repeatedly touted the cryptocurrency, saying his company would accept it for payment for some merchandise. https://t.co/Yi1LQAtR7l
Moms looking for virtual camaraderie can find kinder, gentler online communities in alternative apps and websites explains @juliejargon #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/iaZlXcf7b1 https://t.co/FRp3XwW3Fp
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/c8O1QDsvv3 https://t.co/MKPO7nB2Ku
Breaking: Covid-19 deaths in the U.S. reached the highest level since last February after Omicron, though milder for some, spread with record-breaking speed https://t.co/POFb7IbMkc
Breaking: David Ortiz was elected to baseball’s Hall of Fame. Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens, tied to the sport's steroid era, were denied entry. https://t.co/qNU5L1UPci
Meta said that its research team built a new artificial intelligence supercomputer that the Facebook parent company maintains will soon be the fastest in the world https://t.co/JPwHbAerwR

Elon Musk wants McDonald’s to start accepting dogecoin for payment. The Tesla CEO has repeatedly touted the cryptocurrency, saying his company would accept it for payment for some merchandise. https://t.co/dpqpTtPdMD
As Roger Federer fades and Novak Djokovic runs into travel hurdles, Rafael Nadal is one match away from the Australian Open final https://t.co/lz9Nj0eYiR
Neil Young says Spotify has a responsibility to mitigate the spread of misinformation on its platform https://t.co/Fax7aBR55x
Pfizer has begun testing a vaccine that targets the Omicron variant. Initial study results are expected in the first half of the year. https://t.co/Rm6ribIl75

Facebook says it’s helping millions of the world’s poorest people get online through programs that allow them free data. Many of these people end up being charged, collectively, an estimated millions of dollars a month. https://t.co/oKu9LdoRKK
Sony Music said it bought Bob Dylan’s entire catalog of recorded music, spanning the artist's six-decade career https://t.co/lRnqD767Zl
A stampede at a soccer stadium in Cameroon’s capital city killed at least six people and injured many more during an international tournament https://t.co/yMNGt0xr6G
Amy Schneider has won her 39th straight "Jeopardy!" game, the second-longest winning streak ever behind Ken Jennings https://t.co/glu5q6pHdA
President Biden called a Fox News reporter who asked him about the potential political consequences of inflation a “stupid son of a bitch” at a White House event Monday https://t.co/uehPFYLgFE

Seven Virginia school boards sued Republican Gov. Glenn Youngkin for making mask-wearing in schools optional, arguing that the executive order set to take effect Monday violates the commonwealth’s constitution https://t.co/kzYgQhRmF1
President Biden called a Fox News reporter who asked him about the potential political consequences of inflation a “stupid son of a bitch” at a White House event Monday https://t.co/4FZq3gRmGJ
Amy Schneider has won her 39th straight "Jeopardy!" game, the second-longest winning streak ever behind Ken Jennings https://t.co/CR5iKdsRFF

From @WSJopinion: Biden suggests that Germany is one of America’s most important allies, writes @TomRtweets. Given Berlin’s policies toward the nation’s two pre-eminent adversaries, it’s hard to see how Biden’s claim holds up. https://t.co/WVG4WjmLF3

Washington, D.C., and some states filed new lawsuits against Google, accusing it of deceiving consumers by recording their location even after users tried to turn off the company’s tracking https://t.co/BkvNrTKhNA

Russian President Vladimir Putin wants to move against Ukraine now because he sees it slipping away from his grasp, writes @GeraldFSeib. But the reasons he may think he’s free to act actually lie in three other countries. https://t.co/bF8yB8uTlO
The Pentagon placed hundreds of U.S. troops on standby for deployment to Eastern Europe, officials said, an escalation toward U.S. military involvement https://t.co/4rhFOMNSCK
The pandemic has imposed a steep toll on hundreds of thousands of international students enrolled at Chinese universities but locked out of the country for two years https://t.co/WxSA8gVVdM
American workers hold a lot of bargaining power as companies scramble to find more labor. Can it last? https://t.co/gBuyXmkEVq

The Chiefs and Bills played an all-time classic Sunday. It also raised a problematic question for the NFL: Why was one of the most important moments the flip of a coin to determine who got the ball in overtime? https://t.co/pgQ9Smudu3

Stringent rules to try to keep Hong Kong free of Covid-19 are driving away more foreign executives, chipping away at the city’s decades-old status as one of the world’s top business hubs https://t.co/2j4ZLghWBn
The decision, announced Sunday, comes as Russia continues to build up its forces near Ukraine and U.S. officials have warned that an attack could come at any time https://t.co/M3CII2v89K
NATO allies are bolstering the alliance’s eastern flank in response to Russia’s military buildup around Ukraine https://t.co/S7qUEY6f1N
Thierry Mugler, the French fashion designer who dressed celebrities including Beyonce, Lady Gaga and Kim Kardashian, has died at age 73 https://t.co/r71Ad18aKB
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/fIb9oz1Amn

“Out of all those packages, you picked mine?” Train robberies resulting in thousands of boxes of stolen goods are on the rise in Los Angeles—and no one can agree on who's to blame. https://t.co/HVQvMGqK9i

In rural America, one or two missing workers can shut down an entire clinic. Now many healthcare workers are out sick with Omicron, and patients who drove hours for care are being told to go home. https://t.co/Q3okaQ0jhF
Arise? Adieu? Irate? Wordle has people debating the best five-letter words https://t.co/cSal4lBKoS
The longest U.S. war is not Afghanistan—it’s the War on Drugs. Could a strategy based on harm reduction succeed where law enforcement has failed https://t.co/gbzyzHZt8K
From @WSJopinion: The Biden presidency is suffering the failure of its ideas, writes @KimStrassel https://t.co/IpAdo8sOoj
America launched the War on Drugs more than 50 years ago. Drugs are winning. https://t.co/0wAjDPei0X

“Out of all those packages, you picked mine?” Train robberies resulting in thousands of boxes of stolen goods are on the rise in Los Angeles—and no one can agree on who's to blame. https://t.co/2ntk01vmUO
A cold-case investigation might have uncovered who betrayed Anne Frank’s family and turned them over to the Nazis https://t.co/00fDFuc1Bf

New Zealand will move to its highest level of Covid-19 restrictions as it tries to contain an Omicron outbreak that also led Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern to cancel her wedding plans https://t.co/PYYcxXeI7z
Germany’s dependence on Russian gas has left Europe short of options to sanction Moscow if it invades Ukraine https://t.co/3TauUQC8rc

Protesters rallied in the nation’s capital Sunday against government mandates for Covid-19 vaccinations, a sign of the challenges for public-health officials looking for ways to persuade more Americans to get the shots https://t.co/8jVdSD6ax2
Apple’s vision for life after the iPhone is coming into view https://t.co/aHYFYf5FJX

Middle age can be lonely. Moms in this often overlooked age group are struggling to find meaningful connections. “Social media has made me feel less isolated, but more lonely,” one said https://t.co/BT00ByollP
Heard on the Street: The lithium used to make batteries for EVs is getting dear; but that is only the leading edge of the supply-chain problem https://t.co/Gt2YW2fti6

“Out of all those packages, you picked mine?” Train robberies resulting in thousands of boxes of stolen goods are on the rise in Los Angeles—and no one can agree on who's to blame. https://t.co/SEosn2NtHJ

The Cincinnati Bengals hadn’t won a playoff game in 31 years. Now they’ve won two in a week, and are one victory from the Super Bowl. Columnist @JasonGay on a franchise’s stunning revival: https://t.co/sLtnGgXylx
Since ancient times, humans have tried to make water serve political ends, as a foundation of empire and a weapon in wartime. https://t.co/d1tYqmAylc

The head of the German navy resigned on Saturday after saying that Russia would never surrender Crimea to Ukraine and that President Vladimir Putin only wanted respect, in comments that caused a diplomatic row between Berlin and Kyiv. https://t.co/3Fw7tjV9vt
